result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Edward Amory

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas Edward Amory appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mackenzie Christensen in court for Nicholas Edward Amory. 
3:00 p.m.
Copy of Information.
Waives reading.
Enters not guilty pleas.
Court schedules STC on next available regular date - attys may contact JA to get sooner date.
3:05 p.m.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas Edward Amory in court, in custody.  Attorney Mackenzie Christensen in court for Nicholas Edward Amory. 
Atty Christensen - requests hearing today.
ADA calls witness, Officer Justin Fischer, sworn and examined.
Identifies Deft.
Atty Christensen cross-examines.
ADA calls witness, Narcotics Investigator Spencer Elias, sworn and examined.
Shown Exhibit #1 - Criminal Complaint - offered and received.
Identifies Deft.
Atty Christensen cross-examines.
ADA provides argument.
Atty Christensen provides argument.
Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial.
3:35 pm
Letter to Commissioner re: Deft to appear in person

8:55 AM Defendant Nicholas Edward Amory appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mackenzie Christensen in court for Nicholas Edward Amory. 
Court calls case.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Christensen heard - has reviewed with deft.
Deft understands.
Waives formal readings.
Requests prelim.
Deft waives time limits.
Court schedules with parties.
8:56 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
8:48 AM Defendant Nicholas Edward Amory appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Court inquires on Atty.
Deft heard - qualifies for PD representation, but has not been appointed an atty yet.
Atty Spansail is present in the courtroom and is heard - there is a conflict so an atty still needs to be appointed.
Court schedules with parties.
8:51 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas Edward Amory appeared by Zoom video, in custody. 
Court calls case. 
Copy of complaint. 
Maximum penalties and charges. 
Deft would like an atty- might be able to hire private.
Needs to contact PD if unable to afford private counsel. 
ADA spks on bond recommendation. 
Court imposes: $15,000 cash bond with conditions: sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or any controlled substance without a valid Rx. and no contact with Co-Deft D.B.
Court schedules with parties. 
3:23 PM
Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
